CARPHA REPDU has the regional mandate to facilitate, coordinate, and promote public health research including M&E. It conducts training in Basic Research Skills, Data Management and Analysis, Research Ethics, M&E and Grant Writing. The training gives public health professionals the skills to respond to challenges using a scientific approach. CARPHA REPDU is the regional health institution with the mandate from CARICOM Member States to stimulate, promote and coordinate health research in the Caribbean. Through a cooperative agreement (January 2012 – August 2015) with the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), CARPHA REPDU has provided technical assistance and support to MOHs to strength M&E systems.
This cooperative agreement is designed to increase the ability of ministries of health to collect, analyze and use M&E data and strategic information effectively to inform policy, set priorities, make data informed decisions, and improve program performance. CARPHA REPDU will work with ministries of health to improve collection, analysis, and use of M&E data and strategic information. This work will include developing a standardized approach to program monitoring, data collection, analysis and use of data for decision-making; serving as the lead regional M&E training provider; providing leadership in setting M&E standards and coordinating M&E activities; and supporting the development of national strategic plans.
